Kyunghoon

Introduction

Min Kyung Hoon is a South Korean singer and entertainer under Long Play Music, he is best known for being the Main Vocalist, Face and Maknae of the rock-ballad band BUZZ, along with being a member of the rock-ballad duo Universe Cowards with SUPER JUNIOR's Kim Heechul.

BUZZ gained extreme popularity since debut, while promoting their 3rd album "Perfect", Kyunghoon had made a lyrical mistake in a performance of the hit song "You Don't Know Men", which earned him the name "Ssamja" (The lyrical mistake he made).

In May of 2007, BUZZ began a temporary disbandment, as all members excluding Kyunghoon had started to begin their mandatory military service. During this time Kyunghoon went on to make his solo debut on December 5, 2007, with the album "Im.pres.sive".
Due to the negative reception of Kyunghoon's solo debut album and single, he had found himself in a slump, battling extreme depression and alcoholism.

In April of 2014, BUZZ had announced their return and were no longer disbanded.
The following year, Kyunghoon had joined the JTBC variety show "Knowing Brothers", this along with him making music with BUZZ again had gained him immense popularity and became a fan favourite on the show.

In autumn of 2016, Kyunghoon and SUPER JUNIOR's Kim Heechul released a duet as Universe Cowards, named "Sweet Dream". The song was extremely successful, topping the South Korean Gaon Digital Charts, earning themselves an all-kill.
